private_information: I am allowed to move disks A, B, C, D (A is smallest, D is largest among my disks).
agent_1.goal: Contribute moves so the final configuration is achieved: left peg (top->bottom) A, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle peg (top->bottom) B, C; right peg (top->bottom) D.

private_information: I am allowed to move disks E, F, G (E smallest of mine, G largest).
agent_2.goal: Contribute moves so the final configuration is achieved: left peg (top->bottom) A, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle peg (top->bottom) B, C; right peg (top->bottom) D.

private_information: I am allowed to move disks H, I, J (H smallest of mine, J largest).
agent_3.goal: Contribute moves so the final configuration is achieved: left peg (top->bottom) A, E, F, G, H, I, J; middle peg (top->bottom) B, C; right peg (top->bottom) D.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate the agents' primitive move lists and produce a correct PDDL domain and problem for FastDownwards that yields the complete ordered plan achieving the final configuration.

public_information: There are three pegs named left, middle, and right.
Only one disk may be moved at a time and only the top disk of any peg can be moved.
A larger disk cannot be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Disks are labeled A (smallest) through J (largest).
Agents are restricted to moving only the disks listed in their private information.
Primitive move format expected: 'agent_i: move disk X from peg1 to peg2' where peg1 and peg2 are left, middle, or right.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1. You can propose primitive moves for the Tower of Hanoi given your allowed disks. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves in the exact textual format: 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Respect the global rules provided in the public information and do not attempt to move disks you are not allowed to move.
moves.prompt: Your name is agent_1. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following knowledge: {agents->agent_1->private_information} This is the global goal to solve: {agents->agent_1->goal} Think step by step and provide an ordered list of primitive moves that you are responsible for. Only include moves you are allowed to perform. Follow the primitive move format exactly.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_2. You can propose primitive moves for the Tower of Hanoi given your allowed disks. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves in the exact textual format: 'agent_2: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Respect the global rules provided in the public information and do not attempt to move disks you are not allowed to move.
moves.prompt: Your name is agent_2. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following knowledge: {agents->agent_2->private_information} This is the global goal to solve: {agents->agent_2->goal} Think step by step and provide an ordered list of primitive moves that you are responsible for. Only include moves you are allowed to perform. Follow the primitive move format exactly.

moves.system_prompt: You are agent_3. You can propose primitive moves for the Tower of Hanoi given your allowed disks. Provide an ordered list of primitive moves in the exact textual format: 'agent_3: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'. Respect the global rules provided in the public information and do not attempt to move disks you are not allowed to move.
moves.prompt: Your name is agent_3. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following knowledge: {agents->agent_3->private_information} This is the global goal to solve: {agents->agent_3->goal} Think step by step and provide an ordered list of primitive moves that you are responsible for. Only include moves you are allowed to perform. Follow the primitive move format exactly.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL problems targeting the FastDownwards planner. Your job is to integrate the primitive move lists from the agents and produce a correct PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that represents the Tower of Hanoi instance and yields the complete, ordered plan when solved by FastDownwards. Keep the actions of each agent distinct by naming them with the agent prefix (for example move-agent_1). Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Ensure types, predicates, and action schemata reflect disk sizes and peg relations so FastDownwards can plan a valid sequence.
pddl.prompt: There are three agents contributing primitive moves and you will receive their move lists. You will receive the following inputs: {pddl->input} The global task to solve is: {agents->orchestrator->goal} Here is the environment public information: {environment->public_information} Here is the initial and goal configuration: initial {environment->init->initial_configuration_top_to_bottom} goal {environment->init->goal_configuration_top_to_bottom} Here is the move list from agent_1: {moves_agent_1} Here is the move list from agent_2: {moves_agent_2} Here is the move list from agent_3: {moves_agent_3} Integrate these move lists, resolve any ordering ambiguities and produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem specifically intended for the FastDownwards planner. Keep agent actions distinct and map each primitive textual move into action instances or ensure the domain allows generating those moves. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> and the problem between <problem></problem>.
